document.headline: Festival Playlist Generator
document.overview: Built an AI-powered festival playlist generator that uses OCR to extract artist names from posters and automatically creates Spotify playlists. Features real-time processing and intelligent artist recognition.
impact: 95% accuracy in artist name recognition from festival posters
3-second average processing time for poster analysis
Supports 5+ image formats with intelligent preprocessing
Smart artist name normalization and fuzzy matching
buildNotes: OCR preprocessing pipeline with image enhancement
Artist name normalization using ML and manual curation
Spotify OAuth integration with secure token management
Real-time progress indicators and error handling

body.raw:
# Turning Festival Posters into Perfect Playlists Music festivals are incredible experiences, but discovering new artists from crowded lineups can be overwhelming. This project combines computer vision, AI, and music APIs to instantly transform any festival poster into a curated Spotify playlist. ## The Problem Festival discovery is broken: - **Overwhelming lineups** with 50+ artists - **Time-consuming research** to preview each artist - **Manual playlist creation** taking hours - **Missing hidden gems** in smaller text ## The Solution An intelligent pipeline that: 1. **Extracts text** from festival posters using advanced OCR 2. **Identifies artists** with smart name normalization 3. **Searches Spotify** for verified artist profiles 4. **Creates playlists** with representative tracks 5. **Provides previews** without requiring authentication ## Live Demo Upload a festival poster and watch the magic happen:

ðŸš§ Interactive demo will be rendered here

Features: Drag & drop upload, real-time processing, preview generation

## Technical Deep Dive ### OCR Pipeline - **Image preprocessing** with contrast enhancement and noise reduction - **Tesseract.js integration** for browser-based text extraction - **Multi-language support** for international festivals - **Text confidence scoring** to filter low-quality extractions ### Artist Recognition Engine - **Smart normalization** handling common variations (& vs and, feat. vs featuring) - **Fuzzy matching** for OCR errors and typos - **Genre-based filtering** to avoid false positives - **Manual curation database** for edge cases ### Spotify Integration - **OAuth 2.0 flow** with PKCE for security - **Rate limiting** and error handling - **Track selection algorithm** favoring popular but representative songs - **Playlist metadata** with custom descriptions and cover art ### User Experience - **Progressive enhancement** - works without JavaScript for basic functionality - **Real-time feedback** with processing progress indicators - **Responsive design** optimized for mobile upload workflows - **Accessibility features** including screen reader support ## Results & Impact ### Technical Metrics - **95% accuracy** in artist name extraction from clear posters - **3-second average** processing time for typical festival lineups - **5+ format support** including PNG, JPG, HEIC, WebP - **Zero server costs** - fully client-side processing ### User Experience - **One-click creation** from poster to playlist - **Instant previews** without requiring Spotify login - **Smart deduplication** handling artist name variations - **Shareable results** with unique playlist URLs ## Technical Challenges ### OCR Accuracy Festival posters have complex layouts with varying fonts, colors, and sizes. I implemented: - **Adaptive preprocessing** adjusting for different poster styles - **Text region detection** to focus on artist name areas - **Confidence-based filtering** to reduce false positives ### Artist Matching Variations in artist names created matching challenges: - **Normalization rules** for common patterns (The Beatles vs Beatles) - **Spotify search optimization** using multiple query strategies - **Fallback mechanisms** for artists not on Spotify ### Performance Optimization Client-side processing required careful optimization: - **Image compression** to reduce processing time - **Progressive loading** for better perceived performance - **Worker threads** to prevent UI blocking ## Future Enhancements - **AI-powered genre detection** for smarter playlist curation - **Multi-platform support** for Apple Music, YouTube Music - **Social features** for sharing and collaborative playlists - **Analytics dashboard** for festival trend analysis ## Key Learnings 1. **OCR is surprisingly good** - modern libraries can handle complex layouts 2. **User feedback is essential** - iterative improvements based on real usage 3. **Edge cases matter** - spent 80% of time handling unusual poster formats 4. **Performance perception** - good loading states matter more than raw speed

document.headline: Music Analytics Platform
document.overview: Designed and built an interactive music analytics dashboard processing 10M+ data points daily, helping artists and labels make data-driven decisions about their music strategy.
impact: 50,000+ daily active users across music industry
1.2s average page load time with complex visualizations
10M+ data points processed in real-time
35% increase in user engagement through intuitive design
buildNotes: Custom visualization library built on D3.js
Real-time data streaming with optimistic updates
Responsive design system with component library

body.raw:
# Visualizing Music Data at Scale

The music industry generates massive amounts of data, but artists and labels struggle to extract actionable insights. This platform transforms complex streaming, social, and sales data into intuitive visualizations that drive strategic decisions.

document.headline: Notebook sharing at Spotify
document.overview: Architected and shipped a notebook-sharing feature to 2,000+ users, reducing workflow friction by 89% and pioneering Git-independent sharing for non-technical stakeholders.
impact: Reduced steps from 9 to 1 click with measurable gains
Pioneered Git-independent sharing for non-technical stakeholders
Implemented robust authentication and permission system
Achieved 99.9% uptime during peak traffic periods
buildNotes: RFC â†’ feedback loop â†’ launch pipeline diagram

body.raw:
# Building the Future of Data Collaboration

At Spotify, data scientists and analysts work with complex notebooks that power everything from recommendation algorithms to business intelligence. However, sharing these notebooks was a painful process that involved multiple steps, version conflicts, and required deep Git knowledge.

## The Challenge

The existing workflow was cumbersome:
1. Export notebook to file
2. Upload to internal Git repository  
3. Create pull request
4. Wait for code review
5. Navigate permissions
6. Share access link
7. Recipient downloads file
8. Import into their environment
9. Resolve environment conflicts

This 9-step process was creating significant friction, especially for stakeholders who weren't engineers but needed to access and understand the data insights.

## The Solution

I designed and built a one-click sharing system that:

- **Eliminated Git complexity** with direct notebook URLs
- **Preserved execution state** so recipients see outputs immediately
- **Implemented granular permissions** for security compliance
- **Added real-time collaboration** for live editing sessions

## Technical Architecture

### Backend Infrastructure
Built on Spotify's microservices architecture with:
- **Node.js API gateway** for request routing and authentication
- **Java services** for core business logic and notebook processing
- **PostgreSQL** for metadata and permissions storage
- **Redis** for session management and real-time features

### Frontend Experience
- **React + TypeScript** for type-safe component development
- **WebSocket integration** for real-time collaboration
- **Progressive enhancement** to work without JavaScript

### DevOps & Reliability
- **Docker containerization** for consistent deployments
- **Kubernetes orchestration** for auto-scaling
- **Comprehensive monitoring** with Datadog and custom metrics

## Impact Metrics

The results exceeded expectations:
- **2,000+ active users** within first month
- **89% reduction** in sharing friction (from 9 steps to 1 click)
- **3x increase** in cross-team collaboration
- **99.9% uptime** during peak traffic periods

## Key Learnings

1. **User research is crucial** - spent significant time with data scientists to understand pain points
2. **Security can't be an afterthought** - built permissions system from day one
3. **Real-time features require careful state management** - learned about conflict resolution
4. **Monitoring is essential** - comprehensive observability helped maintain reliability

document.headline: Cross-cultural ML Research
document.overview: Researched and developed multilingual music recommendation models that understand cultural context and musical preferences across 12 languages, achieving 23% accuracy improvement over monolingual approaches.
impact: 23% improvement in cross-cultural recommendation accuracy
40% reduction in model size through efficient architectures
12 languages supported with cultural context awareness
Published research presented at international conference
buildNotes: Cultural embedding spaces for music preference modeling
Efficient transformer architectures for resource-constrained deployment

body.raw:
# Bridging Cultures Through AI Music Understanding

Music is deeply cultural, but most recommendation systems ignore cultural context. This research explored how machine learning models can understand and respect cultural differences in musical preferences across different languages and regions.

document.headline: Government AI Ethics Platform
document.overview: Built a comprehensive AI ethics compliance platform for government agencies, streamlining the review process and ensuring responsible AI deployment across 15 federal departments.
impact: Served 15 government agencies with unified platform
98% compliance score on federal AI ethics standards
75% faster processing time for AI project reviews
Reduced manual paperwork by 60 hours per project
buildNotes: Secure multi-tenant architecture with agency isolation
Advanced audit trails and reporting systems

body.raw:
# Responsible AI for Government

Government agencies need robust frameworks for ethical AI deployment. This platform provides comprehensive tools for evaluating, monitoring, and ensuring compliance with federal AI ethics standards.
